snippet: The multidisciplinary artist, who also performs music under the moniker Peggy Honeywell, unveils her new painting style in an exhibition in New York.
abstract: The multidisciplinary artist, who also performs music under the moniker Peggy Honeywell, unveils her new painting style in an exhibition in New York.
lead_paragraph: Clare Rojas, the Bay Area-based multidisciplinary artist, refuses to confine her expansive practice to a single medium. Instead, she glides from paintbrush to pen, from camera to guitar (or banjo — she produces bluegrass-infused music under the moniker Peggy Honeywell), and in recent years has become known for creating powerful folk-art-inspired tableaus that tackle traditional gender roles.

headline.main: On View | Clare Rojas Gets in Touch With Her Abstract Side
